domain.name: Research and Development
domain.description: The Research and Development domain focuses on the systematic investigation and study to develop new products, improve existing products, and innovate processes.

processes.name: Idea Generation
processes.description: The process of generating new ideas for products, services, or improvements.

subprocesses.name: Market Research
subprocesses.description: Conducting research to understand market needs and trends.

subprocesses.name: Customer Surveys
subprocesses.description: Collecting feedback from potential customers.

subprocesses.name: Competitive Analysis
subprocesses.description: Analyzing the strengths and weaknesses of competitors.

subprocesses.name: Brainstorming Sessions
subprocesses.description: Organizing sessions to generate creative ideas.

subprocesses.name: Facilitated Workshops
subprocesses.description: Structured sessions guided by facilitators.

subprocesses.name: Idea Evaluation
subprocesses.description: Assessing ideas for feasibility and potential.

subprocesses.name: Innovation Network
subprocesses.description: Engaging with external networks to foster innovation.

subprocesses.name: Partnership Development
subprocesses.description: Building partnerships with other organizations.

subprocesses.name: Technology Scouting
subprocesses.description: Identifying emerging technologies and trends.

processes.name: Product Development
processes.description: The process of designing, creating, and testing new products.

subprocesses.name: Concept Development
subprocesses.description: Developing a detailed product concept.

subprocesses.name: Prototyping
subprocesses.description: Creating a preliminary model of the product.

subprocesses.name: Design Specifications
subprocesses.description: Defining technical specifications and requirements.

subprocesses.name: Testing and Validation
subprocesses.description: Testing the product to ensure it meets requirements.

subprocesses.name: Quality Assurance
subprocesses.description: Ensuring the product meets quality standards.

subprocesses.name: User Testing
subprocesses.description: Gathering feedback from end-users.

subprocesses.name: Launch Planning
subprocesses.description: Preparing for the product launch.

subprocesses.name: Market Strategy
subprocesses.description: Developing a strategy to introduce the product to the market.

subprocesses.name: Supply Chain Coordination
subprocesses.description: Ensuring all logistical aspects are in place for launch.

processes.name: Post-Launch Review
processes.description: Evaluating the product's performance and capturing lessons learned.

subprocesses.name: Performance Analysis
subprocesses.description: Analyzing product performance data.

subprocesses.name: Sales Analysis
subprocesses.description: Reviewing sales data for insights.

subprocesses.name: Customer Feedback
subprocesses.description: Collecting and analyzing feedback from customers.

subprocesses.name: Impact Assessment
subprocesses.description: Assessing the impact of the product on the market.

subprocesses.name: Market Share Analysis
subprocesses.description: Determining the product's market share.

subprocesses.name: Competitive Positioning
subprocesses.description: Evaluating the product's position relative to competitors.

subprocesses.name: Continuous Improvement
subprocesses.description: Identifying areas for future improvement.

subprocesses.name: Lessons Learned
subprocesses.description: Documenting key learnings from the project.

subprocesses.name: Process Adjustments
subprocesses.description: Refining processes based on review outcomes.

dependencies.description: Market research informs the concept development by providing insights into customer needs.
Ideas generated during brainstorming sessions guide the testing and validation process.
Launch planning influences the performance analysis by setting initial expectations and metrics.
Quality assurance findings can lead to process adjustments for continuous improvement.
Customer feedback from post-launch review can guide future market research efforts.
